img.style: width: 250px; height: 239px;
width: 500px; height: 489px;

span.span: Macy Harvey is the daughter of Jolean Harvey. During high school, Macy has been active in FFA (4 years), Yearbook (4 years), Student Council (4 years), Scholar Bowl (2 years), Volleyball (2 years) and FCCLA (1 year). After high school, Macy plans to attend Frontier Community College and pursue a career in the medical field.

strong.span: I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. Today, Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker announced that remote learning in Illinois will be extended through the end of the 2019-20 school year.

span.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; text-align: justify; font-size: 24px;

strong.span: Although in-person learning has been suspended for the remainder of the year, I assure you our entire staff remains committed to learning and engaging with all students through remote learning, as well as continuing with our food distribution program.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 24px;

strong.span: Like you, we are saddened by the reality that our school community will not be able to reconvene in person this school year due to this public health crisis. So many of you have worked so hard to learn and grow in both the classroom and in extracurricular activities that today’s announcement may feel like a step back. We need to focus on staying healthy, and continuing our time away will help us to take care of each other.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 24px;

strong.span: As this announcement about the end of the school year was just made by Governor Pritzker this afternoon, it will take us a few days to sort out the many details we need to take care of what for what remains of this school year. Please be patient as we work as a district to get information to you in the next several weeks. We will continue to use our school messaging system, school website, and PBIS page to get this information to you.

span.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; text-align: justify; font-size: 24px;

strong.span: What can you do to make a difference? For now, continue to work on the materials you picked up in your packets Monday. I can’t stress how important it is to complete your work during this time so you can continue to grow and flex your brain. Learning must continue so you will be ready when we come back next fall. Details with plans for the remainder of the school year will be given in the coming weeks through our approved channels.

span.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; text-align: justify; font-size: 24px;

strong.span: I know this is not the school year that any of us imagined, but I want to thank you for your patience and understanding as we have dealt with this unprecedented situation together. This period of Remote Learning offers us new ways to learn and grow, and out of this Pandemic, we will emerge stronger. Plans will be underway soon for the return to in-person learning next school year.

span.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; text-align: justify; font-size: 24px;

strong.span: It’s important we continue to work together and support our students. I can't thank you enough for all that you are doing as we all work together through this.

span.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; text-align: justify; font-size: 24px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 24px;

strong.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: x-large;

div.style: font-family: verdana, sans-serif;
font-family: verdana, sans-serif;

span.style: font-size: xx-large; font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 192, 0);
font-size: x-large; font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 176, 80);

br.span: Continued School Break Information for Parents/Students

span.style: font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

br.span: Assignment packets will be available for you to pick-up on Tuesday 3-31-20 from 8:00 – 3:00. These assignments for your child are a continuation of the materials that were previously sent home at the beginning of this break. Please have your child complete the work over the break to the best of his or her ability. Teachers will be checking their school e-mail periodically each day of the break so please e-mail your child’s teacher with any questions. The teacher e-mail addresses can be accessed on the school website at claycityschools.org, or continue to communicate with teachers as you have done thus far in the year.

As part of the directive from Gov. Pritzker, all school activities, practices, events, screenings, etc. have also been cancelled. Once this school closure is over and students return to school, we will provide information on rescheduled dates as well as information for school activities.

The Governor and the Illinois State Board of Education
extended the school shutdown through Gov. Pritzker’s “Shelter in Place” order. That order and the school closure extends through April 7th .

We will be making food available for students only during the school closure. Each day we will provide a sack meal that will contain breakfast and lunch for that day.
Meals will be “grab and go” and we will set up a “drive through” pick up system at designated distribution sites.
Those sites will be at the front door of the elementary school and the Sailor Springs American Legion.
The school site will be open 7:30 – 10:00 a.m.
and the Legion pickup will be available 9:00 – 10:00 a.m. daily.
In order to prepare enough meals we would like you please contact the school via the PBIS Facebook page or call 618-676-1431 and we will have them ready for you to pick up.

During this unprecedented time in history we appreciate your understanding and support for our students, school, and community. Clay City is a wonderful caring district that has shown through these troubling times that we can and have looked out for each other.

strong.span: All of us from the school want to say thank you and keep up the great support for everyone!!

br.span:
Please feel free to contact us at 618-676-1431 or via e-mail at ccroy@claycityschools.org if you have any questions.
With much care and appreciation for everyone,
The Clay City Schools Faculty, Staff, Administration,
and Board of Education

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: The Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) in coordination with the Illinois Poison Control Center have launched the Illinois Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Hotline and email address to answer questions Local Health Departments, clinicians, and the general public may have regarding the 2019 novel Coronavirus.
The hotline and email address were created to provide consistent information, answer questions, share facts about symptoms, and provide up-to-date information from the CDC.

span.strong: Illinoisans can dial 1-800-889-3931 twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week or email

br.span: The 2020 Census is important for our community. Did you know that over 1,000,000 children were not counted in the 2010 census? That translates into a loss of funding of $940 per person. For 2020, the estimates are $2000-2400 per person. Please help our community by accurately reporting the number of people in your household including all children born on or before April 1, 2020. Accurate counts determine funding for our schools, our health department programs like WIC, free and reduced lunches for children, and access to rural healthcare. Even if you don't use these programs, accurate numbers are important for the greater community.

span.br: Find more information by clicking below.

br.span: Coach Hance and the JHVB Girls

td.span:
The Pioneer® brand A-Series Soybeans Big A Challenge celebrates the connection between next-generation Pioneer® brand A-Series soybeans and next-generation agriculturalists. Fifteen FFA chapters in Iowa and Illinois were selected to participate and demonstrate their creative talent by decorating a 7-foot-tall Big A statue.
It’s time to select your favorite in the Big A Challenge. Cast a vote in the People’s Choice Award for your favorite Big A statue design until Aug. 30.
The winning chapter will be announced Sept. 5 and will receive a Pioneer branded item for each chapter member. Follow #FFAseries on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for additional details.
